oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Einfluss von Pseudomonas fluorescens auf Ertrag von Weizen und mikrobielle Biomasse des Bodens
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Fließbach, Andreas
Mäder, Paul
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soil biology
Soil quality
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: P. fluorescens is used in agriculture and horticulture as a plant growth promoting rhizobacterium. It colonizes root surfaces effectively and excretes compounds that are influencing plant nutrient uptake and plant health. Soils with different initial biological fertility were analysed 18 and 60 days after inoculating the freshly sown wheat plants with a suspension of a rifampicine tolerant strain of P. fluorescens CHA0, in order to evaluate its survival and lasting effect on soil microbial biomass. P. fluorescens had a lasting effect in soils with low initial biomass, but no lasting effects were found in biologically active soils.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Fließbach, Andreas and Mäder, Paul (2009) Einfluss von Pseudomonas fluorescens auf Ertrag von Weizen und mikrobielle Biomasse des Bodens. Poster at: 10. Wissenschaftstagung Ökologischer Landbau, Zürich, 11.-13. Februar 2009.
